node.title: Family stranded in Simpson Desert after campervan bogged on flooded roads
node.description: Rescue authorities are currently working on a plan to retrieve a family, believed to be from Perth,Â  who are trapped in outback South Australia because of torrential downpours.
node.content:
["A family of four remains stranded in South Australia's outback more than a day after their campervan became\u00a0bogged because of torrential rain.", "Emergency supplies have been dropped to the family, believed to be from Perth, who are surrounded by flooded roads.", "SA Police and the Australian Maritime Safety Authority (AMSA) are currently working on a plan to rescue the travellers, who are about 150 kilometres north-west of Oodnadatta in the Simpson Desert.", "Authorities were notified of the\u00a0whereabouts of the four-wheel drive when an emergency beacon was activated at about 11:00am on Friday.", "", "
The four-wheel drive is bogged and surrounded by flooded roads.(Australian Maritime Safety Authority)
", "AMSA said a Challenger rescue plane was dispatched from Essendon,\u00a0dropping water and a satellite phone.", "While rescue efforts have been hindered by weather conditions,\u00a0SA Police is currently working on a ground response.", "\"Due to severe wet weather, roads in the area are flooded and inaccessible for several days,\" the spokeswoman said.", "\"The remoteness of the location is also hampering ground rescue efforts.\"", "", "
The stranded travellers may not be rescued until Monday at the earliest.(Australian Maritime Safety Authority)
", "SA Police said a rescue operation was not likely before Monday at the earliest, because roads in the area remained saturated.", "Parts of South Australia, including inland regions,\u00a0were inundated with heavy rain on Friday."]
